name: topresults1.png
copy: The default view, which shows a selection of results for each category. This is what the user sees when they search via the main searchbar. (In this example, the search has been run on a blank string.) Results are shown by taxonomy; both the order of taxonomies and the number of results shown per taxonomy are customizable from the admin.

name: results-rainier.png
copy: Another top results view, with the search term 'rainier'. The thumbnails were implemented in coordination with design and are designed to emphasize the website's beautiful photography.

name: results-pages-debug.png
copy: A debug view of the search results for "art", which displays the MySQL query used to retrieve page results. It also displays the relevancy calculations for each result, from 1 - 100. Page results can be configured to exclude specific results, in particular form confirmation pages.

name: results-partners-debug.png
copy:
A debug view of the search results for "art", which displays the MySQL query used to retrieve partner results. This query provides an example of how queries search over various metadata as well as how relevancy rankings are calculated.

When writing the queries, I tried to ensure all valid results would be included — among other things, I transformed all text to uppercase and included both strict and fuzzy equality where relevant.

name: results-rainier2.png
copy: A scrolled down view of the "rainier" search, showing partner listing results. As with the page results, photography is emphasized.

name: topresults-iphone.png
copy: The top results search landing page for small viewports (i.e. mobile phones).

name: topresults-ipad.png
copy: The top results search landing page for medium viewports (i.e tablets).

name: topresults-ipad2.png
copy: A scrolled-down view of the search landing page for medium viewports. This is the narrowest width that shows this view.

name: results-rainier-partners.png
copy: Users can filter the search results to show only a certain result type. Here, the results are being filtered to only include local business listings.

name: filter-desktop2.png
copy: Results can be further filtered to match various metadata, depending on the taxonomy. Here, sub-filters specific to the Partners taxonomy can be seen.

name: filter-desktop.png
copy: The region sub-filter of the Partners taxonomy was a particular visual challenge. Because of the large number of locations available, this filter can take up a large amount of screen real estate. On larger screens, the list expands to multiple columns using flex positioning. To accommodate smaller screens and those who might have difficulty scrolling, any "active" (hovered or active) option will display a link which triggers the search. This is also present in the mobile filter.

name: filter-mobile.png
copy: The search filter for small viewports. It appears as an layer over the main page, to allow the user sufficient room to view and understand their options.
